Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in Rome with Air Italia (wont fly with them ever again!) and this hotel beat it: food like on the airplane (literally), no Internet on the rooms and a customer service where they blame you for their bad service.

Reviews.Title: “How does this hotel get 4 stars?”
Reviews.Author: mediterraneum
Reviews.Content: The AC is totally ineffective, the rooms are stuffy, the carpets are smelly, the linens stink, the headboard and lamps are dusty, the walls are dirty, the mattress uncomfortable... It was very hard to sleep the night under those conditions. No safe in rooms. Wi-fi was 16 euro per day. Even a 2 star hotel in little towns give you a free wi-fi.. Morning traffic to airport was bad. Overpriced (over 90 euros). Otherwise, decent breakfast buffet and nice people, although they could have proposed a fan..

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain when it's free, but watch your passports and keys!!”
Reviews.Author: Assen66
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay here due to Hurricane Irene. We concur with all of the other reviews, the good and the bad. Then again, it saved us several hundred dollars by accepting Alitalia's offer to stay here rather than going somewhere else on our own. The hotel is only 10 minutes from a decent beach, several restaurants and cafes are close by, the train to Rome is a 15 minute walk. The hotel is dated, but the service is acceptable. The big issue I had with the hotel was that they took our passports at check-in and when I went back later to retrieve them, the clerk simply handed them to me without verifyin whether or not they were our passports. I asked for the passports for Room 128 and he gave me all of them without opening one of them. Later, when our room key stopped working, I walked up and asked for a new key. They asked which room, I said 128, and they punched in the code and away I went. Essentially, anybody could have taken our passports and anybody could gain access to any room without question. Not a good system with hundreds of travelers coming and going each day.

Reviews.Title: “Not the first choice”
Reviews.Author: Palmu
Reviews.Content: Got stranded on Rome and carrier placed over 200 tired passengers on this hotel. It's not really a place you would choose if you get the chance, and judging from the reviews many guests are unlucky flight passenger. And even if they are a hotel that provides such service for airline carriers, they still should meet the demand with proper number of employees. Room was very worn with bad air, not really a relaxed night after hours of waiting at airport. Our room was at the bottom floor facing the yard with junks of bird feces to welcome us. Our carrier provided us a dinner which started and ended rather chaotic as about 200 hundred people were served by two or three waitress (it was buffet though). Same happened with breakfast. Good thing is that it's within walking distance from Ostia's beach and bars. Also train station is nearby if you feel like taking a trip to downtown Rome.

Reviews.Title: “closing disaster to a phenomenal trip. run from here!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotraveler341
Reviews.Content: yes, we got held hostage here after our plane was cancelled. after 9 glorious days in italy we got stuck in this dark, musty god forsaken place. Thank you alitalia. The service was horrible and it bordered on vindictive. we asked for directions to chuch and the direction they sent us felt like we were walking into the "hood". The room looked and felt like it had not been updated since the 60s and when you laid in the bed, you began to itch just thinking about the place. If you get stuck, take a train back to rome and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel we have ever stayed at in our lives!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lshopsalot
Reviews.Content: If you like mold and mildew on your walls and carpet, torn carpet, broken tvs and toilets that wouldn't flush, this is your place. If you want a courteous staff, clean rooms, great location, then this is NOT the place for you!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, barely”
Reviews.Author: NorthfieldTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the same reason many other reviewers have - we were bumped from our flight. Several other bumped passengers were put up here as well. As other reviewers have noted, the service is inattentive at best, rude and dismissive at worst. The bad: Service (see above). Interior is dark. Elevators are small and ancient. Food is terrible, though it is not dissimilar from other "tourist" hotel food I have experienced in Rome. The neighborhood felt safe, though there was a lot of graffiti and many vacant storefronts. The good: Free shuttle to the airport. Our waiter was friendly. Fairly short walk to the beach, which is impressive. There are lots of private beaches which charge admission, so beware before you inadvertently enter one of these and are charged 4 Euro for the pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate in an emergency”
Reviews.Author: joy12Blairsville_GA
Reviews.Content: My family (five adults) stayed at the hotel in mid May of this year. We stayed two nights in three rooms. Our stays were consecutive nights but broken up by checking out on one morning, going to the airport (FCO) and rechecking in the same afternoon after not being able to travel on that day's flight (one flight a day from FCO - ATL - all of us flying on a stand by basis). The rate for a single room was Euro 83 - with the special tax - and Euro 111 for a double room - (airline employee rates). A free shuttle bus (30 minutes trip from airport to hotel) picks you up at FCO and takes you to the hotel. Our particular driver on our four different trips to and from the airport to the hotel was very surly and not at all helpful with our luggage. He was a decent driver (huge Greyhound size bus) but on one occasion was talking on his cell phone while driving - NOT a good thing to do. Yes, the hotel is showing some wear but the rooms were spotlessly clean, the lounge area nicely decorated and some of the staff were outstanding. We had a room that had a bathtub and an overhead shower, a king size bed and a small balcony. Only electrical outlet was in the bathroom but that was fine - just used for curling iron. Both elevators were small but worked perfectly. Our first night the hotel was almost empty but with an cancelled flight with Luftansia the second night the hotel did get busy. Breakfast was nicely presented in a large room with many choices. The coffee, tea and juices choices are from machines. Martin checked us either in or out as did Fabio. Fabio is to be complimented as to his handling of the 125 plus unhappy guest from the Luftansia flight. He had no other counter help and dealt with each guest in a professional manner. But the very best experience was on our first afternoon at the hotel. My husband was hungry, the restaurant was not open yet and the bartender - Eugenio - made my husband a toasted ham sandwich. We had a nice visit with him and appreciated him going out of his way to serve us. We also had a very good piece of some kind of cake. So thank you again Eugenio. The hotel is about five blocks from the beach area and the walk to and from has lots of choices for restaurants, gelato and viewing daily town life. Several small market areas and street vendors. Be sure an look up and around to see the beautiful displays of flowers on the balconies. One whole balcony was covered with some kind of flowering vine and when you walked by you could smell the wonderful blossoms. The beach area has a long pier and the promonade along the sea side was nice to stroll on. Again, many restaurant choices - fast food and sit down and bar type. Lido di Ostia was a nice quite change from the frantic and hectic pace of Florence and Rome. Over all, even though we did not plan on spending two extra nights in Italy, the Satelite Palace Hotel, was adequate for our extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “No outlets?”
Reviews.Author: Brooke0410
Reviews.Content: As a previous reviewer said this hotel offers good rates to American airlines whose passengers or employees get stranded and has a free shuttle to the hotel. It is also where several of the airline's crews go when they get to rome to sleep before their trip back. The hotel is near the beach but and also has a free shopping center shuttle during the day until 5:30. It did have a little outdoor balcony but no chairs out there. The hotel does have a small restaurant, but it is mainly for conference goers who have vouchers rather than normal customers who want to stop in for a meal. Didn't get to check out the area around the hotel because there were protesters outside yelling about one of the conferences going on in the hotel that night. The room quality was very disappointing. It was clean but the walls had a few light stains and were showing some wear. The TV was extremely small. There were NO outlets in the room and one in the bathroom. So i had to do most of my computer work sitting on the toilet. The hotel internet was 16 euros to connect, which is also bad if you are stranded and trying to get information about flights.

Reviews.Title: “Satellite Hotels Rome - Lido di Ostia”
Reviews.Author: steveafa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in nice place antique rome called Lido di Ostia. Place is famous for the beach and sea food. Regarding this hotel please avoid it if you can. Rooms are okay but the quality and price is very bad. You pay too much for a hotel that would meet my expectations of a 2 star hotel not a 4 star hotel. Internet is too expensive with a swisscom provider. Food in the restaurant is okay but do not waste your time and go outside just next to the hotel you can find some great sea food restaurants which are great.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: cybpiero
Reviews.Content: At some point I thought I was on candid camera. I have never seen any business treat their customers like the staff at this hotel. The only reason they are in business is because they have agreements with airlines. My room was small, had no remote control for the TV, the window could not close properly, mosquitoes were flying around my ear all night. A total nightmare. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel - With”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalGoGo
Reviews.Content: The incredibly unfriendly staff and creepy out of date features of this hotel make me think that the only reason they are in business is because airline staff must stay there. This is no Palace and with so many options in Rome, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: mikec82
Reviews.Content: Our US Airways flight was canceled, so we were given vouchers to stay and eat at this "4-star hotel". It is about a 10-15 minute ride via bus, from the airport. Upon arrival, the staff was courteous and able to answer any questions we had, despite our language barrier. We paid for wifi-access but were unable to ever successfully connect. No refund was given. The food was fine, although we were told to sit with a group of people we didn't know at a large table. Not a big fan of family style dining, but it was not a huge deal. The room smelled musky, and the large mirror was covered in mold. This was a huge turn-off. The bed was fine, as was the bathroom. Overall not a great experience, but some things were ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fly Alitalia if you want a long layover”
Reviews.Author: shantihalloul
Reviews.Content: Well, we are traveling from the world cup in SA, spent a great night in Doha (thank you Qatar airways), went to Tunisia for a week (our kids 2, 4, & 6 are there with family; we had a wonderfull time). Our flight from Tunisia was delayed and to make a long story short we were stuck in Rome for the night. The Satellite Palce hotel was very kind to us. The room was less than decent, yet I was grateful that my kids had a place to stay. The food was decent, this means that the kids did eat. So it must be OK. It was a short walk from the beach....a beach we will never forget. We had a great time in Rome, Thank You

Reviews.Title: “Basic Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Senior60+
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night in order to be close to the airport. It's a decent place to sleep for one night but not much else. It is located about one-half mile from the ocean. The overall look of the hotel is that it is getting a little shabby. Our room and the adjacent bathroom were small, but clean. The staff was not very helpful. They weren't rude - they just didn't go out of their way to provide information or suggestions. I never saw a smile. The free breakfast was adequate but nothing special. The wi-fi service is quite expensive and I never got it to work. A staff member tried to help but we were unsuccessful even after calling the Internet service provider. I finally used the work station in the lobby at a rate of 0.35 Euros per minute. The airport shuttle service worked as advertised. Overall, this place is OK if you just need a place to sleep. Don't set your expectations high.

Reviews.Title: “Alitalia went on strike, so I stayed here for eight hours....”
Reviews.Author: sachahuista
Reviews.Content: I never intended to bed down for the night in Rome, but thanks to Alitalia going on strike causing me to miss my connecting flight, I was given a free room, dinner and breakfast by the airline at this random hotel (which I guess has a deal with the airline) in the Fiumicino area of Rome - a good 20 minutes away by the free airport shuttle bus. I never paid for a thing - I was bussed there at 11pm, and was given a room straightaway, before settling down to a pretty amazing dinner buffet at 11.30pm. For the record, the hotel's near to Lido North metro stop, but you can use the shuttle bus to the airport which leaves every half-hour (my arrived on time) Rooms and corridor are a little old and dark, but beds are quite comfortable. No in-room safe, but satellite TV available and wi-fi as well (I think). Reception area looks pretty grand, and there's a bar and a restaurant/banqueting room. Plenty of little shops around the area (I took a walk around the block after dinner). Shower wasn't great - water was too hot. Can't give any more views or opinions. Suffice to say that I'd never want to stay there again unless someone else paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Closet stunk, room musty, shuttle to airport not reliable. Food good.”
Reviews.Author: SolinaJVP
Reviews.Content: Staff was neutral but sometimes negative towards Americans. Closet in room stunk so badly that we could not use it. Had to leave room windows all full open to minimize the musty smell of the room. Fortunately only there one night, waiting for a flight from Rome to Washington, DC Dulles Airport. Food at restaurant was good.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid by all means, unless...”
Reviews.Author: vpzone
Reviews.Content: ...you missed your flight and it is provided for free. Quite old, small and shabby rooms, dirty shower. Staff is neutral. The restaurant with hot food works till midnight. Although it might make a Michelin star restaurant somewhere in the Netherlands, for Italy - such food is a disgrace. It takes 20 minutes (not 10 minutes as you might be told) by shuttle bus and 10 minutes by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LDNisALRIGHT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because our flight was delayed and we missed our connection. Seems like most people stay here because the airline they're travelling with put them there. Very basic hotel, nothing special with outdated decor though the bathroom was very clean with the tiniest shower. There was hot food even after 11pm and it was nice with a surprisingly good selection at that hour. Breakfast was good, again, with a good selection of hot and cold food. We had enough time to eat it as the shuttles run every 30 minutes. Good hotel for one night as it was only 15 minutes to and from the airport without traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: monica1978
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at this hotel due to the fact that my flight to Chicago got canceled. The hotel is relatively close to the airport and there is a shuttle bus that takes you there. The problem is that the shuttle runs every hour, therefore you may have to wait a little bit for it. If the traffic is good, you will reach the hotel in about 20 minutes. In my case, it took us almost 1 hour to reach the hotel from the airport. The next morning, though, since I had to be at the airport at 7:30am and there was no heavy traffic, the shuttle got there in no time at all (I think it was even less than 20 minutes). The hotel is nothing special and it provides basic accommodation needs. My room had a very tiny bed for 1 person and the bathroom was really small. I am not sure how the double rooms are, but the single rooms are small. The hotel restaurant was good and I really enjoyed spending quality time at their bar. Dinner and breakfast were good. Nothing fancy, but good food. There was classical music being played at the bar and I really enjoyed my cup of tea after the hassle of the flight cancellation! The bar area was not crowded at all (3 people all together) and I really felt relaxed when I left the bar and went up to my room to sleep and get ready for the early morning flight. If you need a place to stay for an early flight, this may be a good option for you, but I would not stay here if I would be visiting Rome. I am not sure how much a room costs since the airline paid for my room, but I am pretty sure it was not cheap since hotels close to any major airport are not cheap.

HotelInfo.Name: Satellite Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Delle Antille 49 | Roma Lido Aly, 00121 Rome, Italy
